intro: Limacia oblonga, commonly known as the broadleaf snail plant, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Limacia oblonga is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and low maintenance requirements. It is drought-tolerant and prefers full sun to partial shade.
